alert.note: Alert for Lipscomb; Ochiltree (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 09 at 1:03AM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...In Oklahoma, Beaver County. In Texas, Lipscomb and Ochiltree Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Whiteout conditions are expected and will make travel treacherous and potentially life-threatening. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. Notify a friend or family of your travel plans. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. In Oklahoma, call 844-465-4997 for road information. In Texas, call 800-452-9292 for road information. A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you and notify a friend or family of your plans. If you get stranded, stay in your vehicle.
